sen.j: 春分（しゅんぶん）は、二十四節気の1つ。
sen.e: Vernal Equinox ("Shunbun") is one of the 24 seasons in the solar year.
Vernal Equinox ("Shunbun") is one of the 24 seasons in the solar year.
Shunbun (Vernal Equinox) is one of the 24 seasons in the solar year.

sen.j: 3月21日ごろ。
sen.e: It falls around March 21.
It falls around March 21.
It falls around March 21.

sen.j: および、この日から清明までの期間。
sen.e: Or, it is the period from that day until ""Clear and Bright"" (Seimei) season in the same solar calendar.
Or, it is the period from that day until ""Clear and Bright"" (Seimei) season in the same solar calendar.
Or, it is the period from that day until Clear and Bright (Seimei) season in the same solar calendar.

sen.j: 二月中。
sen.e: Mid February
Mid February
Mid February

sen.j: 天文学では、太陽が春分点を通過した瞬間
sen.e: In astronomy the vernal equinox ("Shunbun") is defined as the very moment that the sun transits through the vernal equinox. That is, just when the sun is visible at the celestial longitude of 0 degrees.

In astronomy the vernal equinox ("Shunbun") is defined as the very moment that the sun transits through the vernal equinox. That is, just when the sun is visible at the celestial longitude of 0 degrees.
In astronomy Shunbun is defined as the very moment that the sun transits through the vernal equinox.
sen.cmt: 英語説明削除一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: すなわち太陽の視黄経が0度となった瞬間を春分と定義する。
sen.e: That is, just when the sun is visible at the celestial longitude of 0 degrees.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 『暦便覧』に「日天の中を行て昼夜等分の時なり」と記されている通り、春分では昼夜の長さがほぼ同じになる。
sen.e: In historical almanacs the vernal equinox is explained as being "Mid point between the sun and the heavens when the division between day and night is identical" and, holds true that at the vernal equinox, day and night are roughly the same length.

In historical almanacs the vernal equinox is explained as being "Mid point between the sun and the heavens when the division between day and night is identical" and, holds true that at the vernal equinox, day and night are roughly the same length.

In historical almanacs the vernal equinox is explained as being 'Mid point between the sun and the heavens when the division between day and night is identical' and, holds true that at the vernal equinox, day and night are roughly the same length.

sen.j: しかし、実際には、昼の方が夜よりも長い。
sen.e: However, in actual fact, daytime is longer than the night
However, in actual fact, daytime is longer than the night
However, in actual fact, daytime is longer than the night

sen.j: 日本付近では、年による差もあるが、平均すれば昼が夜よりも約14分長い。
sen.e: In the vicinity of Japan there are variations from year to year but, on average daytime is approximately 14 minutes longer than night time.
In the vicinity of Japan there are variations from year to year but, on average daytime is approximately 14 minutes longer than night time.
In the vicinity of Japan there are variations from year to year but, on average daytime is approximately 14 minutes longer than night time.

sen.j: これは、次の理由による。
sen.e: This is because of the following reasons.
This is because of the following reasons.
This is because of the following reasons.

sen.j: 大気による屈折で太陽の位置が実際より上に見えるため
sen.e: Due to refraction in the atmosphere, the sun can look higher than it actually is.
Due to refraction in the atmosphere, the sun can look higher than it actually is.
Due to refraction in the atmosphere, the sun can look higher than it actually is.

sen.j: 太陽が上に見える角度の分、日出が早く、日没が遅くなる。
sen.e: The portion of the sun that is visible due to the higher aspect results in an earlier dawn and later sunset.
The portion of the sun that is visible due to the higher aspect results in an earlier dawn and later sunset.
The portion of the sun that is visible due to the higher aspect results in an earlier dawn and later sunset.

sen.j: 屈折は太陽が地平線に近いほど大きくなる。
sen.e: Refraction makes the sun look larger the closer it is to the horizon.
Refraction makes the sun look larger the closer it is to the horizon.
Refraction makes the sun look larger the closer it is to the horizon.

sen.j: 国立天文台では、太陽が地平線付近にある時の、その角度を35分8秒と見積もっている。
sen.e: At the National Astronomical Observatory of Japan, when the sun is close to the horizon, the angle is estimated to be 35 minutes 8 seconds.
At the National Astronomical Observatory of Japan, when the sun is close to the horizon, the angle is estimated to be 35 minutes 8 seconds.
At the National Astronomical Observatory of Japan, when the sun is close to the horizon, the angle is estimated to be 35 minutes 8 seconds.

sen.j: ここから計算される日出・日没の時間の差は約2分20秒である。
sen.e: From this it can be calculated that the time difference between dawn and sunset is 2 minutes 20 seconds.
From this it can be calculated that the time difference between dawn and sunset is 2 minutes 20 seconds.
From this it can be calculated that the time difference between dawn and sunset is 2 minutes 20 seconds.

sen.j: 太陽の上端が地平線と一致した時刻を日出あるいは日没と定義している。
sen.e: Because dawn or sunset is defined as the very moment when the top edge of the sun is aligned with the horizon
Because dawn or sunset is defined as the very moment when the top edge of the sun is aligned with the horizon
Dawn or sunset is defined as the very moment when the top edge of the sun is aligned with the horizon

sen.j: これにより、太陽の半径の分、日出が早く、日没が遅くなる。
sen.e: due to this, the radius of the sun can cause dawn to be early or sunset late.
due to this, the radius of the sun can cause dawn to be early or sunset late.
Due to this, the radius of the sun can cause dawn to be early or sunset late.

sen.j: ここから計算される日出・日没の時間の差は約1分5秒である。
sen.e: The variance in timing between dawn and sunset can be extrapolated from this to be 1 minute 5 seconds.
The variance in timing between dawn and sunset can be extrapolated from this to be 1 minute 5 seconds.
The variance in timing between dawn and sunset can be extrapolated from this to be 1 minute 5 seconds.

sen.j: これらを合わせると、日出は、太陽の中心が地平線から上がるより3分25秒早く、日没は、太陽の中心が地平線より沈むより3分25秒遅くなる。
sen.e: Putting both these together, at dawn the centre of the sun rises from the horizon 3 minutes 25 seconds faster and, at sunset sinks 3 minutes 25 seconds slower from the centre of the sun to the horizon.

Putting both these together, at dawn the centre of the sun rises from the horizon 3 minutes 25 seconds faster and, at sunset sinks 3 minutes 25 seconds slower from the centre of the sun to the horizon.

Putting both these together, at dawn the centre of the sun rises from the horizon 3 minutes 25 seconds faster and, at sunset sinks 3 minutes 25 seconds slower from the centre of the sun to the horizon.

sen.j: したがって、春分の日の昼の長さは約12時間7分、夜の長さは約11時間53分である。
sen.e: Accordingly, the length of daytime at the vernal equinox is approximately 12 hours 7 minutes and, the night approximately 11 hours 53 minutes long.
Accordingly, the length of daytime at the vernal equinox is approximately 12 hours 7 minutes and, the night approximately 11 hours 53 minutes long.
Accordingly, the length of daytime at the vernal equinox is approximately 12 hours 7 minutes and, the night approximately 11 hours 53 minutes long.

sen.j: そして、実際に昼夜の長さの差が最も小さくなる日は春分の4日程度前になる。
sen.e: Also, actually the day when the variance between day and night is substantially smaller occurs approximately 4 days after the vernal equinox.
Also, actually the day when the variance between day and night is substantially smaller occurs approximately 4 days after the vernal equinox.
Also, actually the day when the variance between day and night is substantially smaller occurs approximately 4 days after the vernal equinox.

sen.j: 春分を含む日には、太陽は真東から上って真西に沈む。
sen.e: During those days forming the vernal equinox, the sun rises from due East and sets due West.
During those days forming the vernal equinox, the sun rises from due East and sets due West.
During those days forming the vernal equinox, the sun rises from due East and sets due West.

sen.j: 赤道上の観測者から見ると、太陽は正午に天頂を通過する。
sen.e: If a person makes observations from above the equator, the sun passes through the zenith at mid day.
If a person makes observations from above the equator, the sun passes through the zenith at mid day.
If a person makes observations from above the equator, the sun passes through the zenith at mid day.

sen.j: 北極点または南極点の観測者から見ると、春分の太陽はちょうど地平線と重なるようにして動き、上ることも沈むこともない。
sen.e: If a person makes observations at the North or South Pole, the vernal equinox sun will appear to be moving right along the horizon; not rising or sinking.
If a person makes observations at the North or South Pole, the vernal equinox sun will appear to be moving right along the horizon; not rising or sinking.
If a person makes observations at the North or South Pole, the vernal equinox sun will appear to be moving right along the horizon; not rising or sinking.

sen.j: 日本においては、春分の日は国民の祝日となる。
sen.e: In Japan, Vernal Equinox Day ("Shunbun No Hi") is a public holiday.
In Japan, Vernal Equinox Day ("Shunbun No Hi") is a public holiday.
In Japan, Shunbun No Hi (Vernal Equinox Day) is a public holiday.

sen.j: 春分の日は、国立天文台の算出する天文学的春分日を元にして閣議決定され、前年2月に官報で告示される。
sen.e: The Japanese Cabinet decides upon "Vernal Equinox Day" based on the astronomical Autumnal Equinox calculated by the National Astronomical Observatory of Japan and, an announcement of the decision is officially gazetted in February the previous year.

The Japanese Cabinet decides upon "Vernal Equinox Day" based on the astronomical Autumnal Equinox calculated by the National Astronomical Observatory of Japan and, an announcement of the decision is officially gazetted in February the previous year.

The Japanese Cabinet decides upon Shunbun No Hi based on the astronomical Autumnal Equinox calculated by the National Astronomical Observatory of Japan and, an announcement of the decision is officially gazetted in February the previous year.

sen.j: 天文学に基づいて年ごとに決定される国家の祝日は世界的にみても珍しい。
sen.e: It is unusual elsewhere in the world to have a public holiday decided upon each year based on astronomy.
It is unusual elsewhere in the world to have a public holiday decided upon each year based on astronomy.
It is unusual elsewhere in the world to have a public holiday decided upon each year based on astronomy.

sen.j: またこの日をはさんで前後7日間が春の彼岸である。
sen.e: Also, Vernal Equinox Day occurs during the 7 days of spring "Higan" (equinoctial) week.
Also, Vernal Equinox Day occurs during the 7 days of spring "Higan" (equinoctial) week.
Also, Vernal Equinox Day occurs during the 7 days of spring Higan (equinoctial) week.

sen.j: 第二次大戦前は春季皇霊祭として祭日であった。
sen.e: Prior to WWII the day was a national holiday in recognition of the imperial ceremony of ancestor worship.
Prior to WWII the day was a national holiday in recognition of the imperial ceremony of ancestor worship.
Prior to WWII the day was a national holiday in recognition of the imperial ceremony of ancestor worship.

sen.j: ヨーロッパなどでは、春分をもって春の開始とする。
sen.e: In Europe etc, the vernal equinox marks the opening of spring.
In Europe etc, the vernal equinox marks the opening of spring.
In Europe etc, the vernal equinox marks the opening of spring.

sen.j: いくつかの国では休日とされる。
sen.e: The day is a public holiday in a number of countries.
The day is a public holiday in a number of countries.
The day is a public holiday in a number of countries.

sen.j: キリスト教で復活祭の日付を算出するには、春分を基点としている。
sen.e: In Christianity, the vernal equinox is used as a reference point when calculating the date of Easter. The Sunday following the first full-moon after the vernal equinox is set as Easter.
In Christianity, the vernal equinox is used as a reference point when calculating the date of Easter. The Sunday following the first full-moon after the vernal equinox is set as Easter.
In Christianity, the vernal equinox is used as a reference point when calculating the date of Easter.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 春分後最初の満月の次の日曜日を復活祭の日と定める。
sen.e: The Sunday following the first full-moon after the vernal equinox is set as Easter.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: この算出方法をコンプトゥスという。
sen.e: This calculation method is called "Computus".
This calculation method is called "Computus".
This calculation method is called "Computus."

sen.j: ただし、ここでいう「春分」は暦の上での3月21日に固定されており、天文学上の春分を含む日とは必ずしも一致しない。
sen.e: That said, while the calendar "vernal equinox" date is fixed as March 21, the dates of astronomical vernal equinox days do not always coincide.
That said, while the calendar "vernal equinox" date is fixed as March 21, the dates of astronomical vernal equinox days do not always coincide.
That said, while the calendar 'vernal equinox' date is fixed as March 21, the dates of astronomical vernal equinox days do not always coincide.

sen.j: 「満月」も簡素化した計算によって求められており、天文学上の満月とは必ずしも一致しない。
sen.e: While the "full moon" dates can also be obtained from simplified calculations, the astronomical full moon dates may not always coincide.
While the "full moon" dates can also be obtained from simplified calculations, the astronomical full moon dates may not always coincide.
While the 'full moon' dates can also be obtained from simplified calculations, the astronomical full moon dates may not always coincide.

sen.j: この算定法は第1ニカイア公会議で定められた。
sen.e: This method of calculation was decided upon at the First Council of Nicaea.
This method of calculation was decided upon at the First Council of Nicaea.
This method of calculation was decided upon at the First Council of Nicaea.

tit.e: The 72 'climates' of the year (based on the 24 solar seasons further divided into three).

tit.e: Approximate order of solar calendar seasons.

sen.j: 啓蟄 → 春分 → 清明
sen.e: Insects Awaken ("Keichitsu") => Vernal Equinox ("Shunbun") => Clear and Bright ("Seimei")
